verb.description: Make small movements, especially of the hands and feet, through nervousness or impatience.
examples: the audience had begun to fidget on their chairs

noun.description: A quick, small movement, typically a repeated one, caused by nervousness or impatience.
examples: he disturbed other people with convulsive fidgets

origin: Late 17th century: from obsolete or dialect fidge to twitch; perhaps related to Old Norse fikja move briskly, be restless or eager.
